intro: Sloanea cararaensis, commonly known as the Carara sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within lowland forests. Sloanea cararaensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited use in traditional medicine.
